long_desc.thetext:
Look into enabling a community-driven contribution environment (particularly now that qooxdoo-contrib was cleaned up on Github https://github.com/qooxdoo-contrib - thanks, Derell), e.g.:
* encourage "from the users, by the users" * offer (to advance) a self-consistent, self-contained infrastructure * to jumpstart transfer existing repositories catalog and platform to this Github organization, https://github.com/qooxdoo/contrib-catalog https://github.com/qooxdoo/contrib-platform * check basic webpage possibilities (gh-pages?) * ... including transfer of existing contrib catalog frontend, http://qooxdoo.org/contrib/catalog/ * maybe explicitly outsource contrib loader code (generator extension) * ...

The GitHub organization "qooxdoo-contrib" now contains:
* the contrib-catalog (renamed in catalog) * the contrib-platform (renamed in platform) * some css resources and fonts copied from resources.qooxdoo.org used as git submodule (resource repo) * the organization website (GitHub feature) * the contrib-catalog website now hosted by GitHub (realized as "gh-pages" branch of the catalog repo)
With two new websites hosted by GitHub:
* http://qooxdoo-contrib.github.io/ * http://qooxdoo-contrib.github.io/catalog
Future ToDos: -------------
Once the qooxdoo-contrib GitHub organization is designated to be the successor of the former repos (under the qooxdoo GitHub organization) and websites (http://qooxdoo.org/contrib/catalog):
* change the "CONTRIB_CATALOG_BASEURL" macro in the "base.json" pointing now to the catalog hosted by the qooxdoo-contrib GitHub organization * take down http://qooxdoo.org/contrib/catalog and redirect to catalog hosted by GitHub
Sounds good, could you open up follow up bog reports for the mentioned tasks?
